title: On the old forums "jpeg" must be used as an extension for attachments to work properly. Meanwhile...
body:
On this "community beta" or "boards" or whatever it's called, "jpeg" is an invalid extension, and "jpg" must be used.

I specifically made all my screenshots save as "jpeg" to use them on your old forums (which I still use). Can you fix it so "jpeg" is valid on these new boards too? So I don't have to switch it to "jpg"?

(inb4 someone says "jpg" works on the old forums too. Yes, it does, but it has unrealistic file size, length, and width requirements - it basically only works if you're posting a thumbnail lol - so it is essentially broken, and "jpeg" must be used)

replies.body: it appears "jpeg" isn't doing the same thumbnail/preview that "jpg" allows on this site. (see test posts I made)
Will look into it! Not sure where it sits in priority though :(
Lol, didn't know that about the .JPG vs .JPEG file requirements. Good stuff to know
Install FEK and be a man.
